snippet: The decision was prompted by the outgoing Czech president’s decision to grant amnesty to more than 6,000 prison inmates and to halt prosecution of executives charged with fraud.
abstract: Czech Senate votes to accuse departing Pres Vaclav Klaus of high treason, largely symbolic rebuke of Klaus, who has often polarized Czech society; decision to forward treason complaint to country's Constitutional Court was prompted by amnesty granted by Klaus, freeing more than 6,000 inmates and halting prosecutions of some prominent business executives and officials charged with fraud.

byline.original: By DAN BILEFSKY and HANA DE GOEIJ
byline.contributor: Hana de Goeij reported from Prague and Dan Bilefsky from Budapest.

lead_paragraph: The decision was prompted by the outgoing Czech president’s decision to grant amnesty to more than 6,000 prison inmates and to halt prosecution of executives charged with fraud.

headline.seo: Czech Senate Rebukes Outgoing President Vaclav Klaus
headline.main: Czech Senate Accuses Outgoing President of High Treason
headline.print_headline: Czech Republic: Senate Accuses President of Treason
